thread.title: After Holiday, Yuan Hit Strongest Level Since Devaluation
thread.title_full: After Holiday, Yuan Hit Strongest Level Since Devaluation - WSJ

author: Fiona Law
title: After Holiday, Yuan Hit Strongest Level Since Devaluation
text: The yuan hit the strongest level since its recent devaluation amid the central bank’s robust fixing and improved market sentiment. After a weeklong holiday, China reopens with the USD/CNY once dipping below, and now hovering at 6.35--the strongest level for the Chinese currency after the People’s Bank of China devalued it on Aug. 11. This compares with 6.3571, which is where the pair closed before the holiday began. The fixing, from where the currency can trade 2% higher or lower, was set at 6.3505, also the strongest since mid-Aug. It comes as the People’s Bank of China’s deputy governor Yi Gang said yesterday...
